shared_ptr_132.hpp

00001 #ifndef BOOST_SERIALIZATION_SHARED_PTR_132_HPP
00002 #define BOOST_SERIALIZATION_SHARED_PTR_132_HPP
00003 
00004 // MS compatible compilers support #pragma once
00005 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1020)
00006 # pragma once
00007 #endif
00008 
00010 // shared_ptr.hpp: serialization for boost shared pointer
00011

00019 // note: totally unadvised hack to gain access to private variables
00020 // in shared_ptr and shared_count. Unfortunately its the only way to
00021 // do this without changing shared_ptr and shared_count
00022 // the best we can do is to detect a conflict here
00023 #include <boost/config.hpp>
00024 
00025 #include <list>
00026 #include <cstddef> // NULL
00027 
00028 #include <boost/serialization/assume_abstract.hpp>
00029 #include <boost/serialization/split_free.hpp>
00030 #include <boost/serialization/nvp.hpp>
00031 #include <boost/serialization/tracking.hpp>
00032 #include <boost/serialization/void_cast.hpp>
00033 
00034 // mark base class as an (uncreatable) base class
00035 #include <boost/serialization/detail/shared_ptr_132.hpp>
00036 
00038 // Maintain a couple of lists of loaded shared pointers of the old previous
00039 // version (1.32)
00040 
00041 namespace boost_132 { 
00042 namespace serialization {
00043 namespace detail {
00044 
00045 struct null_deleter {
00046     void operator()(void const *) const {}
00047 };
00048 
00049 } // namespace detail
00050 } // namespace serialization
00051 } // namespace boost_132
00052 
00054 // sp_counted_base_impl serialization
00055 
00056 namespace boost { 
00057 namespace serialization {
00058 
00059 template<class Archive, class P, class D>
00060 inline void serialize(
00061     Archive & /* ar */,
00062     boost_132::detail::sp_counted_base_impl<P, D> & /* t */,
00063     const unsigned int /*file_version*/
00064 ){
00065     // register the relationship between each derived class
00066     // its polymorphic base
00067     boost::serialization::void_cast_register<
00068         boost_132::detail::sp_counted_base_impl<P, D>,
00069         boost_132::detail::sp_counted_base 
00070     >(
00071         static_cast<boost_132::detail::sp_counted_base_impl<P, D> *>(NULL),
00072         static_cast<boost_132::detail::sp_counted_base *>(NULL)
00073     );
00074 }
00075 
00076 template<class Archive, class P, class D>
00077 inline void save_construct_data(
00078     Archive & ar,
00079     const 
00080     boost_132::detail::sp_counted_base_impl<P, D> *t, 
00081     const BOOST_PFTO unsigned int /* file_version */
00082 ){
00083     // variables used for construction
00084     ar << boost::serialization::make_nvp("ptr", t->ptr);
00085 }
00086 
00087 template<class Archive, class P, class D>
00088 inline void load_construct_data(
00089     Archive & ar,
00090     boost_132::detail::sp_counted_base_impl<P, D> * t, 
00091     const unsigned int /* file_version */
00092 ){
00093     P ptr_;
00094     ar >> boost::serialization::make_nvp("ptr", ptr_);
00095     // ::new(t)boost_132::detail::sp_counted_base_impl<P, D>(ptr_,  D()); 
00096     // placement
00097     // note: the original ::new... above is replaced by the one here.  This one
00098     // creates all new objects with a null_deleter so that after the archive
00099     // is finished loading and the shared_ptrs are destroyed - the underlying
00100     // raw pointers are NOT deleted.  This is necessary as they are used by the 
00101     // new system as well.
00102     ::new(t)boost_132::detail::sp_counted_base_impl<
00103         P, 
00104         boost_132::serialization::detail::null_deleter
00105     >(
00106         ptr_,  boost_132::serialization::detail::null_deleter()
00107     ); // placement new
00108     // compensate for that fact that a new shared count always is 
00109     // initialized with one. the add_ref_copy below will increment it
00110     // every time its serialized so without this adjustment
00111     // the use and weak counts will be off by one.
00112     t->use_count_ = 0;
00113 }
00114 
00115 } // serialization
00116 } // namespace boost
00117 
00119 // shared_count serialization
00120 
00121 namespace boost { 
00122 namespace serialization {
00123 
00124 template<class Archive>
00125 inline void save(
00126     Archive & ar,
00127     const boost_132::detail::shared_count &t,
00128     const unsigned int /* file_version */
00129 ){
00130     ar << boost::serialization::make_nvp("pi", t.pi_);
00131 }
00132 
00133 template<class Archive>
00134 inline void load(
00135     Archive & ar,
00136     boost_132::detail::shared_count &t,
00137     const unsigned int /* file_version */
00138 ){
00139     ar >> boost::serialization::make_nvp("pi", t.pi_);
00140     if(NULL != t.pi_)
00141         t.pi_->add_ref_copy();
00142 }
00143 
00144 } // serialization
00145 } // namespace boost
00146 
00147 BOOST_SERIALIZATION_SPLIT_FREE(boost_132::detail::shared_count)
00148 
00149 
00150 // implement serialization for shared_ptr<T>
00151 
00152 namespace boost { 
00153 namespace serialization {
00154 
00155 template<class Archive, class T>
00156 inline void save(
00157     Archive & ar,
00158     const boost_132::shared_ptr<T> &t,
00159     const unsigned int /* file_version */
00160 ){
00161     // only the raw pointer has to be saved
00162     // the ref count is maintained automatically as shared pointers are loaded
00163     ar.register_type(static_cast<
00164         boost_132::detail::sp_counted_base_impl<T *, boost::checked_deleter<T> > *
00165     >(NULL));
00166     ar << boost::serialization::make_nvp("px", t.px);
00167     ar << boost::serialization::make_nvp("pn", t.pn);
00168 }
00169 
00170 template<class Archive, class T>
00171 inline void load(
00172     Archive & ar,
00173     boost_132::shared_ptr<T> &t,
00174     const unsigned int /* file_version */
00175 ){
00176     // only the raw pointer has to be saved
00177     // the ref count is maintained automatically as shared pointers are loaded
00178     ar.register_type(static_cast<
00179         boost_132::detail::sp_counted_base_impl<T *, boost::checked_deleter<T> > *
00180     >(NULL));
00181     ar >> boost::serialization::make_nvp("px", t.px);
00182     ar >> boost::serialization::make_nvp("pn", t.pn);
00183 }
00184 
00185 template<class Archive, class T>
00186 inline void serialize(
00187     Archive & ar,
00188     boost_132::shared_ptr<T> &t,
00189     const unsigned int file_version
00190 ){
00191     // correct shared_ptr serialization depends upon object tracking
00192     // being used.
00193     BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT(
00194         boost::serialization::tracking_level<T>::value
00195         != boost::serialization::track_never
00196     );
00197     boost::serialization::split_free(ar, t, file_version);
00198 }
00199 
00200 } // serialization
00201 } // namespace boost
00202 
00203 // note: change below uses null_deleter 
00204 // This macro is used to export GUIDS for shared pointers to allow
00205 // the serialization system to export them properly. David Tonge
00206 #define BOOST_SHARED_POINTER_EXPORT_GUID(T, K)                     \
00207     typedef boost_132::detail::sp_counted_base_impl<               \
00208         T *,                                                       \
00209         boost::checked_deleter< T >                                \
00210     > __shared_ptr_ ## T;                                          \
00211     BOOST_CLASS_EXPORT_GUID(__shared_ptr_ ## T, "__shared_ptr_" K) \
00212     BOOST_CLASS_EXPORT_GUID(T, K)                                  \
00213     
00214 
00215 #define BOOST_SHARED_POINTER_EXPORT(T)                             \
00216     BOOST_SHARED_POINTER_EXPORT_GUID(                              \
00217         T,                                                         \
00218         BOOST_PP_STRINGIZE(T)                                      \
00219     )                                                              \
00220     
00221 
00222 #endif // BOOST_SERIALIZATION_SHARED_PTR_132_HPP
